note.p: Burial: Essenden, near his country house at Hatfield in Hertfordshire
Education: Edinburgh. MD (1854, Aberdeen); LLD (Aberdeen and Edinburgh)

Career: Joined the Royal Navy; Pathologist, Royal Naval Hospital, Haslar; Assistant Physician (1854), Physician (1866), Consulting Physician (1886), all at London Hospital; had a large private practice; died of a paralytic stroke
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 121-123 signed by J H
